sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Workers at the UK's largest container port are set to walk out, joining thousands of others across the country striking for better pay as the cost of living continues to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A cargo ship carrying Ukrainian grain docks in Ireland as UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres inspects another vessel in Istanbul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Another explosion is reported at the HQ of Russia's Black Sea fleet in Crimea, with the Sevastopol governor claiming to have struck down a drone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Greece is regaining control of its economy as the EU ends its enhanced surveillance policy almost 15 years after the country plunged into a financial crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 1,900 workers at the UK's largest container port, Felixstowe, are set to walk out on Sunday for the start of an eight-day strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The action parallels thousands of other workers across the UK, campaigning for better pay as the cost of living continues to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, only one in five UK trains are expected to run, as more than 45,000 workers call for better pay and job security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There is an offer on the table from Network Rail which is 50% of our members. It's a three-year pay deal at 8% and that would have to cover next year as well as this year and last year. Inflation this week on the retail price index was 12.3. So if we accepted that pay offer we would be getting about a quarter of next year's inflation, which is likely to be 15% or 16%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So our members aren't prepared to accept that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The strikes have received mixed responses from the general public, as most of London's underground tube stations will not run because of a separate strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the disruptions have put a stop to some weekend travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yes, I do feel sympathy for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, there's got to be another way because the disruption is phenomenal all over the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It means you can't get anywhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And some argued that the strikes will affect some more than others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm glad that people have the chance to make that point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But of course, it's us suffering and not the guy going to work in their limos and black cap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The strike comes as inflation in the UK has reached 10.1%, a 40-year high, and an increasing number of people are struggling to pay for the rising cost of food and energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Other workers, such as lawyers, British telecom staff and postal workers, have also announced walkouts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: British telecom staff and postal workers have also announced walkouts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A bulk carrier packed with 33,000 tons of Ukrainian grain has arrived at its destination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thanks to a deal brokered by Turkey and the United Nations last month, 27 cargo ships have finally left the Black Sea's ports. The Navistar sailed into finds on the River Shannon and is the first vessel to make the voyage from Ukraine to Ireland since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres inspected the World Food Programme's ship found for the Horn of Africa in Istanbul on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But let's not forget that what we see here in Istanbul and in Odessa is only the more visible part of the solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The other part of this package deal is the unimpeded access to the global markets of Russian food and fertilizer, which are not subject to sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It is important that all governments and the private sector cooperate, bringing them to market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Without fertilizer in 2022, there may not be enough food in 2023." Guterres also said he is working hard with the EU and the US to overcome shipping, insurance and financial obstacles in order to prevent a global food crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He praised the Joint Coordination Centre in the Turkish capital for its efforts monitoring these much-needed deliveries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A Russian-appointed governor in Sevastopol in Crimea

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: claims its defence shot down a drone circulating its Black Sea headquarters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Governor Mikhail Razvodsev told Telegram there was no significant damage or injuries, asking people to remain calm, that the city is under control and that authorities carried out operational services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The headquarters was subject to an attack back on July 31st, where explosives hit the premises, injuring six people in the process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Traditionally, Russia celebrates its Navy Day at the end of July, but festivities were quickly halted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Russia, Defense Ministry spokesman Igor Konashenkov says that more than 100 militants, including 20 so-called US mercenaries, were killed in a high-precision airstrike by the Russian Aerospace Forces near Avdrivka in Ukraine's Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Next Wednesday, however, marks Ukraine's Independence Day, where the country broke away from the Soviet Union in 1991.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As part of those celebrations this year, destroyed Russian tanks are being displayed in Kiev ahead of August 24th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Almost 15 years after Greece plunged into a financial crisis, the country is regaining control of its economy as the European Union ends its enhanced surveillance policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The bloc had carried out quarterly assessments of Greece's public finances in exchange for debt relief payments after the nation suffered a huge recession from 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These last three years constitute, in practice, a response to the lessons of the last 12 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They show the way that we never, ever go back to what we have lived through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They forge our self-awareness and they urge us to move ahead united, armed with the truth and realistic solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The end of the EU's enhanced surveillance will allow Greece greater freedom over its budget, as it, along with the rest of Europe, struggles with the rising cost of living and energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, the country will continue to pay back loans until 2070.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Austria is experiencing extremely heavy rainfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Austria is experiencing extremely heavy rainfall. In the west of the country, like here in Wolfert, meteorologists reported record amounts of rainfall in the past 24 hours. Firefighters and locals alike are working tirelessly to pick up fallen trees and clear flooded roads as best they can. Over 1500 mudslides were recorded, making the clean-up job even more difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These mudslides led to numerous flooding of villages and roads. A large section of the A14 motorway along the Rhine valley had to be closed for many hours, causing motorists to take alternative routes in the severe conditions. Rainfall did stop around midnight, and luckily no injuries have been reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After a bloody 30-hour ordeal, Somali forces claim that they have ended a siege of a hotel in the country's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 13 civilians were killed at the start of the attack by the al-Qaeda-linked military group al-Shabaab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The attackers originally entered the building after detonating bombs and opening fire, trapping people inside the hotel. Officials say they were able to rescue dozens of people, but it is unknown how many people were still trapped at the end of the siege.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people took to the streets of Santiago on Saturday to voice their support

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: for Chile's new constitution. On the 4th of September, more than 15 million Chileans will vote on the proposed draft, which if approved approved will turn the country into a full democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, researchers say the motion to reject the changes is leading in the polls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The new document composed by 154 elected citizens seeks to replace the current 1980 charter written by the dictator Augusto Pinochet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: China has declared its first drought emergency of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This community reservoir in Chongqing has all but evaporated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The giant Yangtze River serves as a lifeline for farms and businesses in the area, but it too is disappearing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This farmer says he is now pumping groundwater, but it is not enough to keep his crops alive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Authorities say an estimated one million people in rural areas will face water shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: An estimated one million people in rural areas will face water shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There has been outrage in Greece after three bears, one of which was still nursing her babies, have been killed in the past month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All three crimes were committed in a protected area near Florina, in the country's northwest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: By putting the matter out in the open, as well as by mobilizing the authorities, we hope this will put an end to this criminal action. And it's good that such actions no longer go unpunished. So the perpetrators, or those who carry out such criminal actions against an animal, which is protected by Greek and European legislation, stop such activities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And of course everyone will be aware that such actions do not go unpunished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Environmentalists say the bears could have been killed for illegible biodiversity reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We do not believe that it is fear per se.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The killing of the bears could be seen as a preventative action that was taken not to damage agricultural or livestock capital which is even more disturbing and infuriating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There are at least 700 brown bears living in the wild in Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The protected species roams the forests and mountains in the north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Greece's deputy environment and energy minister says the ministry is in direct cooperation with the Greek police to resolve the cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will do everything in our power to protect the mammals' population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The bears were shot with a firearm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One leaves behind now orphaned young.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A total of four bears have been killed so far this year.
